Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: portsmouthpeggy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel with another couple. After reading some of the reviews and given that we'd payed £76 per night per couple for a city center hotel, we weren't expecting much. Fortunately, we were proved wrong. The reception was well presented and the receptionist booked us in quickly and spoke really good English. A bell boy lead us to our rooms, opposite each other on the 4th Floor. Again, they were decorated elegantly. There was a strong smell of cleaning fluid, but i'd prefer that to any other smell and it went after a few hours with the window open. The cleanliness of the room and the hotel, overall, was really good....and i'm quite fussy. There was quite a lot of noise when the windows were open, but you are in the middle of Rome and it was fine when shut. There is a mini bar in the room which is, actually,not too badly priced, but we brought drinks in the supermarket down the rd and got ice from the hotel bar. Beer and spirits are expensive in the restaurants, so it's worth having a few beforehand if you're making a night of it! The breakfast was good for continental breakfast and had loads of variety. The roof terrace was a nice way to start the day. You are literally 3 minutes from Termini Station and the metro so you can get around easily. The metro is really cheap too. We mostly walked our way around Rome. From the Colosseum to the Vatican. This is a whole day walk but you get to see all the major attractions and landmarks, if you plan your route. Much better than the open top buses, if you're healthy and fit to do it. Overall, I'd say this place is ideally located for a tourist break. Centrally located with clean rooms and friendly staff. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: RHP38
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for three days;our stay at the Palladium Palace was great. The Front desk attendant Danillo was very helpful and spoke english well. The rooms were very clean and well kept, there was breakfast available every morning. The Hotel is well located, during the late evening I enjoyed the violinist outside of my window from the near by resturant(it was beautiful). We were a couple of blocks from the train station and tours buses and in walking distance of resturants. The overall all expereince was a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice property”
Reviews.Author: calebhays
Reviews.Content: Accommodations were very nice, as was the location. Rooms were warm, but such is Italy! Windows fully open, so that was nice for this warm-blooded American. Room contained two single beds pushed together to form a full-sized bed, as seems to be normal in Italy, as well as a single sized cot. Rooftop breakfast lounge can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Palladium Palace Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Sardinia7
Reviews.Content: Our family of five adults and a toddler recently had a most pleasant stay in this very centrally situated hotel. Booking in and out was painless as they had all our details. The staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable, our rooms were clean, cool, well appointed and well serviced and any special requests we had concerning the toddler were dealt with in a friendly and efficient manner. When we asked the desk staff to recommend a restaurant, they promptly made restaurant bookings for us at the nearby Leonetti's where we were treated like royalty and had some of the best Italian food of our holiday. We will definitely be returning and recommend the Palladium Palace to all our friends unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel sucks at refunding the payment”
Reviews.Author: gauri_1988
Reviews.Content: PLEASE DONT STAY HERE!!!!!!!! You'll ruin your trip!!!!! I had made a booking in september 2011 and cancelled it immediately. The hotel promised to refund one night payment and its been more than 4 months now and they havnt refunded my money.

Reviews.Title: “Tricky Staff”
Reviews.Author: Frank R
Reviews.Content: Our reservations were not maintained and after a long day traveling we were sent to a nearby hotel accompanied by a busboy. The other hotel was noisy at night. The following day we stayed at the Palladium and all was fine. After a cruise, we came back to the same place and we were asked for a credit card "as security". At check out we payed with cash and were charged ten euros more than agreed. We never signed any card payment. I check my AMEX statement and found charges for one night. I complained to the hotel by phone and was answered rudely. I then entered a dispute for the charges with my credit card and after a month the case is still not solved. I do not recommend this place. The location is good but you can find plenty of options at similar or lower prices near Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: ShainavG
Reviews.Content: First, why is this rated a 4 star property? it was not even a 3 star hotel. Rooms were small. With luggage bags, hardly any walking space left in the room. Secondly, the breakfast had very limited options. Third, be cautious of security at night. There could be thieves & robbers just outside the hotel. We had one encounter and had to run to save ourselves, and when we complained to the night-duty staff, they said they can't do anything till we get robbed. Next, be ready for lot of honking whole night if your room is on the road. Good points: Location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, fitness center, good breakfast, nice balcony”
Reviews.Author: treborsf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the train station. I arrived late night by train from the airport and having slept the whole way wasn't tired. I asked to use fitness center gym and it was not a problem. I'm not sure why they don't just leave it unlocked. My friend and I slept great on the 2 twins (European hotels don't usually have 2 full or 2 queen size beds), for that I'd give it another point. People watching from the balcony. Plenty of breakfast. Staff helpful. Only issue was that if the bathtub drain wasn't closed, the sewer smell came up - I think a plumber needs to vent the pipe correctly - we kept it covered after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfasts on rooftop”
Reviews.Author: MaryofMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay here. Had 4 in a room and it worked out fine as room was quite large for a city. Close to train station, easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Yeke
Reviews.Content: Location is good but other everythings are really bad. Rooms are too old and dirty. Staff is not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cathy41
Reviews.Content: Arrived unexpectedly - our other hotel booking fell through. They had a room available and the Reception staff were fantastic. They helped us with everything. Rooms were big and had everything we needed. Breakfast was brilliant on the terrace - we would go back definitely.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump, rude staff 2 star !!!!”
Reviews.Author: PRLady10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no way 4 stars it's smells, nothing works eg air condition, door knobs (my daughter was locked in the washroom)and staff. I asked the manager how to get to the shopping area he rudely replied (you need money to shop.) I was applauded I did not realize he was my banker and knows what I can or cannot afford. As for the location if you like taking the train I guess its good in that sense. This hotel was surround by hostels and other 1 and two star hotels it's felt like I was in the ghetto all immigrants hanging around the street I thought for sure I will have my handbag ripped of me. It smelled like formaldehyde and was very dark. Another night we asked the staff to make us a reservation at a restaurant recommended by a friend from Rome he said to to me oh that this place is very expensive. Again as if he were paying for it. I'm use to service and quality this place was lacking all I would never recommend this not even to my worse enemy. It's a Dump in the ghetto. I spent my last 3 days there after returning from a 3weeks tour of Europe with my husband and daughter. It was not what I expected from a so called 4star hotel. As for breakfast there was a sign saying " Please do not only eat the croissants" are you kidding me it was the most disgusting low class cheap looking breakfast I've ever seen, as I noticed some reviews loved it , it was the lowest quality of food as they come my family and I spare nothing when it comes to good food. We were in Europe and eating great was important. We had a personal driver that said to us this hotel was not good at all, its close to the train, you get all the rif rafs hanging around that neighborhood very dangerous. So I must advise unless you have no other choices don't stay here. We also stayed at the River Palace it was much better location and friendly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: GCas
Reviews.Content: Located in a good area next to Termini station with access to all parts of Rome. Clean, air conditioned room. Excellent service particularly from Carlos who was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast choices limited although quality of what is available is good.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better places for this price”
Reviews.Author: MPeter75
Reviews.Content: Said to be a 4 stars hotel, but I only give it 3 stars. The room and bathroom were tiny even for a single room. You'd better not to open the window if it sees to the busy street even if you are on the 4th floor. The breakfast was OK but the same on every morning. The service was terrible, you have to wait for clean plates, glasses and cutlery. If they run out of something (eg. bread on Sunday morning) the replenishment is slow or is none at all. The breakfast stuff pretends to work hard but you really have to wait minutes for the above mentioned things. The reception staff was helpful. The location is good. Bus stop right in front of the door, both metro lines in the Termini station are within 5 minutes walking. Colosseo is also in convenient walking distance. The internet was charged 3 euros for one hour which is more than expensive. I recommend this hotel only if the distance to the Termini station is your one and only important factor. If not, you can find better places for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: IngridBe
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms in this hotel for two nights. We asked rooms on the backside to avoid the street noise. Both rooms were very (!) small and so were the beds and bathrooms. To our opinion this should be single bedrooms! One off the rooms was a smokers room (we didn't ask for it because we are no smokers). The sigarette smell in combination with a bad smelling cleaning product was terrible. The hotel was very clean and so were the rooms. The staff did their jobs, but they didn't seem very happy with it. The hotel lacked space to sit somewhere quiet... We wonder where this hotel got its 4 stars... We wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Emy1
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late at the Rome airport and needed a place to stay. Our taxi driver suggested this place it was a bit pricey but at the time of night and because it is also in the center of Rome we decided to go for it. Our room had fescos on the wall and was so beautiful. The bathroom was spacious. In the morning we went for breakfast and it was the biggest breakfast spread I have ever seen in Italy. There was anything you could want, either Italian or Canadian type of breakfast. The location was just down the street from the train and bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Very underwhelmed, horrible breakfast, seedy neighborhood by train”
Reviews.Author: Denverbased
Reviews.Content: This was a clean room, and that may be why it is ranked 4 stars, but area is close to train station, and loads of beggars etc made this uncomfortable as spot for two female travelers with a teenager. Room looked right into someone else's kitchen less than 50 feet away, and to top it off, breakfast was horrible. We are used to those fake eggs you get everywhere, but the coffee and tea water came from big cafeteria vats and tasted terrible. Finally, pipes ran all night and it made it sound like it was raining.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini for decent price”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one quick night between cities in Italy. I needed a hotel close to Termini that was reasonably priced. Front desk staff was nice. Small downstairs lobby area and always people checking in, looks popular. The room was small, single bed not the greatest, clean but sunken in. Small TV with limited channels. I think there was a tiny balcony out to the main street behind that steel screen in the room, couldn't really get to it easy. Room wasn't noisy even though it faced a busy street. Room was not too modern or updated looking but the bathroom was. Nice clean bathroom. Breakfast upstairs was good and there's a bit of a view. Not a bad price for the location and the single rooms are only as big as you need.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: samontana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palladium Palace with our friends for leisure purpose. The room was clean but the walls are very thin. They were using a strong disinfectant and it smells like a scotch (like someone broke the battle in the room). Room and bathroom were clean. The breakfast was not so good . It is located 5 min away from the Termini Metro Station. There was a young lady at the reception desk and she was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, clean hotel close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: sleepy38
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel and staff were helpful. Rooms nice and clean but not particularly good size or very modern. Were moved rooms after first night. Locattion close to Temini station, but not the best for the centre of Rome, however it is a pleasant 20-30 minute walk away. Inclusive breakfast was pretty good with a decent variety and choice.

Reviews.Title: “basic 3 star”
Reviews.Author: kingbenny999
Reviews.Content: Basically a standard 3 star hotel - no-where near 4 star at all. Beware they charge for the use of the sauna! Also beware the superior/delux rooms dont have a hot tub jacuzzi, its a multijet shower "jacuzzi".!! lol. And they dont work very well. Dont pay extra for superior room, just get a standard double. Breakfast is basic but satisfactory, no complaints really. Location is good, but for any more than 3 nights, i'd consider staying further into town maybe somewhere like the Navona or trastevere areas... With all the choice of 3/4 star hotels in rome, i'd stay somewhere else if booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near city center and Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Rachappag
Reviews.Content: Recomend this Hotel as a tourist. Walkable distace from city center and Termini station ( Main railay station in Rome ). Hence it will be very convenient for sightseeing and enjoying "The Rome Visit". I booked this hotel on the spot hence I endup paying more money ( 175 Euros for 3 bed room). Complimentory breakfast was also good and over all stay experiance was more than I expected. Book your stay well in advance and enjoy your Rome & Vattican visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent will stay there again when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: eur0peantraveller10
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful and delightful hotel, 5 star in every way. The rooms by European standards are good size, the only thing is that in the USA rooms are normally quite large even singles. The staff are some of the most wonderful, helpful and nicest that I met in Italy. The breakfast spread was incredible, many types of meats and cheeses, hot and cold meats. The eggs were good but you could purchase any type you wanted and were not expensive. The location of the hotel is actually excellent, Termine station is right there only a couple small blocks away where you can get a connecting train or a bus to take you anywhere in the city. There are many places to eat nearby, a store to buy any type of good at good prices is closeby and a potato shop where locals buy pizza and other foods is just 2 doors down for that late night snack. I called the USA and had to charge it to the room and it only cost me the price of the actual phone call, no addition charges were added to the phone call. This hotel does charge to use the computer but compared to other places in Europe the cost was very low, this hotel does not charge any extra for purchases only the price that it costs them to provide. They were wonderful in providing resonably priced transfer, either to the airport or to St. Peters for Sunday mass.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: GLobetrotterMumbai
Reviews.Content: Perfect location– 5 mins walking from Termini Station and close to lot of eating and shopping places. Close to tour operators conducting city tours. Average Cold Breakfast However a major disappointment for a supposedly 4 star- noisy street, conjusted rooms. Definitely wont recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Palladium Palace compares very favorably with others in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TVBH
Reviews.Content: We have read many other reviews about the Palladium Palace, and I can only say that, for the price, those who were negative have not seen the other hotels in Rome. The location is very convenient. We walked everywhere except to the Vatican. Generally speaking, the hotel staff were polite and competent. Not all were as friendly as others, but the information was correct and almost all were polite. The rooms are not big by American standards, but more than adequate by comparison to others. The free breakfasts are great and have a great selection and quality. I have read some who criticize the environs. This is flat out false. There are internet cafes, groceries, plenty of cafes, and a major church within a block. If people are offended by the graffiti, look around the rest of Rome. We never felt unsafe. The bus stop is right in front of the hotel. I would advise not to take the hotel's shuttle service. At Euro 50, it is way overpriced. You can get shuttle service to the airport (Fiumicino) for Euro 31 or even 25 if you look. The advice given by desk staff was always right on target. This is probably the best location you are going to find in Rome and more than adequate facilities and quality of service. The breakfast is a bonus. To get any larger room or more modern you will have to pay a lot more. David and Rebecca Keck, Johnstown, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, nice manager and staff, well located”
Reviews.Author: Paola155004
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights last week (10 and 11 september 2010). It is a great location close to Termini station. There are nice restaurants next to the hotel. I enjoyed walking all the way down via Nationale to Trevi Fountain. The manager Gian Carlo is very classy and very helpful. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless not free, and staff not helpful”
Reviews.Author: sola10
Reviews.Content: Their wireless is NOT free! My reservation indicates that the room includes internet access, and I've called Expedia to verify it is indeed free --- this is the main point for me to choose this hotel, given that it is more expensive than other options I had. However, I was told by them that this is not the case and whatever Expedia says has nothing to do with them. Their manager interpreted my itinerary as something like "the room includes internet doesn't mean it's free", which doesn't make any sense to me --- my room does not include free breakfast either, why don't you mention in the itinerary that it includes breakfast and tell me it is not free when I'm ready for it? I didn't argue with him because my time was not for arguing, and he was nice enough to offer me a two-hour free internet access as a compensation. But I feel that I have to make the situation clear so that people won't be mislead in the future. Also I talked to a staff at the second night --- not helpful at all. About the wireless, the only thing he could say is for me to talk to the manager in the morning (which I understand was out of his control). Later, I found there was no carpet on my bed. Depending on my experience in the first night, I knew I need one, and asked him. Surprisingly, he again told me to wait till the morning as there is nothing he can do. But I need a carpet AT NIGHT! He was very impatient, and finally I slept without carpet, not comfortable at all. Worse, still no carpet for my third night, although he promised one! He couldn't care less...

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GLOBALINDIANS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights.Having had good stays in Milan and Florence and an excellent stay in Venice we had hoped the same here but were sorely dissappointed.The only thing good about this hotel is its location a 5 minute walk from Roma Termini station.There's nothing 4-star about it.Our tiny quadraple room and bath were neat, the inbuilt wall safe took a hotel staffer 15 minutes to open.The A/c is as good as non-functional.The outside temperature was lower than in the room.When we complained about it an Oriental staffer took pains to explain that the A/c was working in perfect condition as if we had never seen an A/c before. Also he had the gall to tell us if we had any problem we should talk to the reception later on as they were very busy.This staff attitude in a 4-star hotel is unbearable.At breakfast everything was in short supply including the cutlery.We strongly feel this hotel should not be labelled 4-star.

Reviews.Title: “About what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: travelmom61
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel through a travel agent and trusted them for experience. I can say that this was about what I was expecting for the price I was willing to pay. The room was small and the air conditioner blew warm air until the last day. ( We overheard the desk clerk tell another guest that the air conditioner was not set to go on until 1 June. This was 26-29 May.) The bathroom was rather large for European standards and the shower was adequate. We were greeted by a very friendly staff who all spoke English. The breakfast was plentiful and there was a good variety. The location of the hotel is excellent but be prepared for noise from the street all night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and lovely hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: patty1075
Reviews.Content: We arrived late without reservations secondary to the airport being closed in Greece due to strikes and rioting. We were happy to find lovely, spacious and clean rooms very close to the Termini Train station. We stayed another night when our flight was cancelled due to the vulcano ash. One staff member went out of his way to help us in calling the airport to rebook our flight. The area around Termini is run down and not that safe especially at night, but taxi's are readily available. The breakfast was adequate. In general the rooms are lovely and the staff accomodating. The Palladium is a good value. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: tucsonrissa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palladium Palace Feb 6th-15th. We did have a very nice time. This hotel is very, very clean. I was surprised judging by the street outside. I was very pleasantly surprised by the inside. It is at a great location. The Termini Station is 1 block to the right and one of Italy's prized Churches, Santa Maria Maggore is 2 blocks to the left. We were very happy with the bathroom. It had a very nice American style shower (not a tub with a handle) although small. My only complaint with the bathroom was the hairdryer. Its a small box with a long vacuum cleaner hose attachment. I never did master this device. The room was good size in depth but very narrow. We had a king size bed and a little desk with a flat screen TV. Beware there is NO DRESSER! There was a closet but would only hold 2 coats. If you like to unpack, there is no place to do this. The foot of the bed gives only about 9 inches till you hit the wall on the other side. The bed was very firm-which we liked. We requested extra pillow on 2 occations and were never given them. I just wadded a couple of sweaters under the pillow given. We were on the 2nd floor and it was noisey. The street below is a major street. We just put ear plugs in and didn't care about it. The breakfast is very decent but no variety. The dining room is very pretty. I suggest to hit breakfast early. A couple days we were all in competition for cups but they were replaced within 10 minutes. The desk staff was helpful if asked, but you must approach them first. If you expect to be greeted when you walk by, you will be disappointed. Beware the hotel inside can be a maze. We often go lost getting out of the elevator... We joked that the elevator moves day to day. If you are looking for a place to eat.. Electra is across the street. I highly recommend it. We ate there 3 times during our stay. We always received excellent service and the food was TERRIFIC! My favorite was spinach ravioli with truffle cream sauce! OMG it was so memorable. Overall we liked our experience here! And we do plan on staying again! We might spring for a slightly larger room if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, OK rooms, OK staff”
Reviews.Author: ragjunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palladium Palace for 4 nights in Dec. Pluses: Location - Just 2 minutes from Roma Termini, so very conveniently located. Even though the hotel is on a busy street, it was very quit inside. The rooms are reasonable sized, the bathroom was also very big with a bathtub. The hotel is at walkable distance from most attractions. Even Vatican was about 4KM away and we ended up walking twice to Vatican. Minuses: The 3rd bed (room # 110) had virtually no support even for a 10 year old, 65lb child. The room, while clean, felt like stuffy, especially when you enter from outside after a day's trip. We ended up keeping the window open, so the room would have some fresh air. I only saw a room heater, so I don't know if the rooms have AC. This maybe worth checking if you are visiting in summer. The staff was neither friendly, nor terrible; they just do their job. The breakfast was rather bland. Internet access costs Euro 3 for every 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Jemima456
Reviews.Content: inreally like this hotel as it was really clean room was very spacious of which three people stayed in. it was really close to the train station and bus station so easy access to public transport it was also very close to a hop on hop off bus stop. it was about 20 mins walk from the centre its self but we used taxis most of the time which are every where. the breakfast was really nice with plenty for everyone although it was a little hard to find as signage is not the best. it is also very close to the collesium. there are some nice resturants right round the corner as well.facitilities in the hotel were good the bar was great eventhough it was only small they had a nice varity of drinks but be careful buying imported drinks they are expensive i paid 10 euros for an absolut vodka and coke even though it tasted like a double it was still expensive so stick to drinking local stuff very lucky for you sambuca lovers. the staff were really nice on my visit they were also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was top”
Reviews.Author: Betty2208
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in a room with double-bed and two single-beds. The single-beds were not as comfortable as the doublebed but it was ok for 4 nights ! The whole Hotel was restored and it looks very like a 4star hotel, very unique. The only thing which was annoying, was the air conditioner. It was extremly loud, but in summer it's so hot even at night , that you have to switch it on ! Breakfast was good, but the assortment was quiet small. Everyday the same cheese and bread. I've read a lot of bad comments about the rooms, but I can't indicate that. You can reach the Termini in 3 minutes and there are a lot of shops nearby where you can buy water or food (wasn't always looking fresh, but ok.. ) Restaurants and even a Mc Donald's are situated nearby. You haven't got a great nightlife in that part of town, and watch out when you want a cocktail! They are sooo expensive and short, unbelievable ! If you stay in this hotel for less than a week, its perfect. ! ( because of the breakfast, it's flavourless to eat one week the same). Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “nasty staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: BKflaneuse
Reviews.Content: yikes!! my boyfriend and I were rerouted to the Palladium Palace for one night after our reservation was supposedly screwed up at the Mecenate Palace down the street. we had no idea what to expect! the street is directly outside of the Termini train station and is a pretty busy thoroughfare with graffiti, buses and lots of crazy folk. we're from NYC though and have traveled quite a bit in European cities so we weren't toooooo shocked... but it had been a long flight and we weren't really in the mood for this adventure. upon entering the hotel we walked right into a showdown with a woman at the reception desk and a guest that was checking out. they were arguing loudly about a $3Euro charge for a wireless connection that the guest claimed not to have been able to use. hectic!! as we were ignored by reception a couple timidly appears behind us asking for their passports from the desk... they were told "oh, they are not ready and we have no IDEA when they will be!" the couple looked confused... and we were reluctant to hand over our own passports a few minutes later... after being ignored for a few minutes longer, we were taken up to our room... which to our surprise was extremely clean, large and ok. we didn't want to hang out there too long though... so after an hour or so, after showering and changing we made our way back to the reception desk to pick up our passports... after being ignored a bit more by the man behind the desk who was taking a personal call we asked for our passports... and were told "oh, they are not ready!" so we asked why they were taking so long and made it clear we weren't going anywhere. our passports were sitting in clear view. the man then picked up the passports, jotted down the info they needed and handed them back to us. it took not even a minute. our room was large and the bed was comfortable and we were tired. so we slept pretty well. there was a LOT of banging against our door all night caused by the other doors however. this wasn't enough to break us of our slumber for one night... but would've been a tragedy to endure for longer than that... luckily were were only at this hotel one night. we didn't eat breakfast so can't review. this is a clean hotel but is kind of far from decent restaurants and has a rather dreary view of the train station. i would recommend this to budget travelers but not my friends. i have just begun writing reviews here after using trip advisor for years to plan my vacations... all of your reviews have made my life much easier! thanks everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jsa4qcktrn
Reviews.Content: We travel to Italy once a year. When we are in Rome, we always stay at the Palladium. This past May, my partner and I booked the hotel online while we were in Gaeta. We didnt realize it was the Soccor Finals. We reserved a room for one night. When we arrived, we were told that the room we reserved was for the night before. We were stunned. Even though it was our fault, we were horrified as the city was booked because of the finals. The front desk couldnt have been more helpful. They helped us find a room in an ok hotel a couple of blocks away. Yes we lost $200.00 as we booked for the wrong date, but with the location, cleanliness, and efficient and helpful staff, we will continue to stay at the Palladium when we are in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice true European-style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChargerDriver
Reviews.Content: We read several reviews prior to staying at the Palladium Palace and honestly, we had some doubts. Our doubts were quickly dispelled once we arrived. The staff was cheerful, friendly, and extremely helpful. We stayed 2 nights prior to our cruise, and 1 night upon our return. The rooms were quite comfortable and well decorated and we had no issues with noise from the street as others have commented. The air-conditioning is not quite up to American standards, but it was certainly adequate, especially since it was 95 degrees plus during our stay. The staff recommended a restaurant that was roughly three blocks away - absolutely outstanding right down to the complementary Lemoncelo as a light dessert drink. Location was great and we had no trouble figuring out the Metro to get to Tivoli Gardens. We noted several negative reviews and can only conclude that the guests probably had an attitude issue when they checked in. We were courteous and the staff was courteous - nothing more need be said. I recommend the Palladium highly - very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mjmizzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Palladium for 3 nights in March 2009. The location of the hotel could not have been better as it is only 5 mins walk, or even less from Termini Station, which connects you directly to Fiumicino Airport, Rome. From the airport, you take the train that takes you directly to Termini Station. The Hotel is also close to the main bus station as it is in front of Termini Station as well as the underground train station (Metro). There are only 2 lines , Line A & Line B which makes it very easy to get around Rome. The hotel is comfortable and very clean. We had a double bedroom with bathroom which were cleaned everyday. An abundant continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, ignorant, cold, a total DISASTER”
Reviews.Author: jspworld
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that Hotel Pallidium was appauling. We arrived there before midnight, after flying from Brussels. They told us that they've already rented our room out to someone else so we had to separate ourselves in two different rooms. Both were far apart. We have never been separated from each other in a hotel before and we've been in 4 star hotels before. We had ordered a "family" room which it said on their website "three single beds". So the next morning, after an awful sleep, we packed our bags hoping that we'll stay in our bedroom as payed for, a month in advance. They told us that if we put our bags and suitcases in one of the rooms we stayed in the previous night, we'll send them to your room. After a whole day of sightseeing, we arrived back to the hotel and gave us the key to what would have been, our room we had payed for. Instead of this, we were given the same room as we left our suitcases - two single beds and a travel bed. We were livid, as you may imagine. A four star hotel and this type of service? Pathetic. We threatened to leave the hotel and demand for our money back. A man who worked in the reception area raised his voice and offended us for two whole hours leaving other visitors who stayed there upset on our behalf. After this two hours, he gave us another room and said "the room which I'm taking you is MORE than what you've payed for". We went to this room and guess what? Different room but same beds but this time, one double bed and a travel bed. We ordered to talk to the manager and once we got hold of him, he was defending the man who was rude to us for the last two hours. This man also told us to pay more as this room was "more than what we payed for". We threatened to leave again but he said that we had to stay. So we did and the room was cold, even when we turned the air conditioning off. We stayed there for three nights, as planned and overall, an awful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Felicecassati
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the front desk we were assigned a room 202 (i think) then to have it changed by a gentlemen at the front desk, at which the lady who was servicing us found very funny. we were then given room 110 and that was the reason for the laughter. The beds were under the stairwell (great for sleeping) and the window looked out to the air conditioning units (lovely) The night staff were rude and not very helpfull when asked about internet use(which is not free) go across the road for that.Breakfast was very basic and if your lucky you will find a clean table and this is 4 stars, 3 at best. We had room service done one day,put my head down for a snooze only to be woken up an hour later,by someone else wanting to clean the room again.Location was the positive as it was close to transport not good for girls on their own as neighbour hood looked a little dogey

Reviews.Title: “Super central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMurrayfamilyEssex
Reviews.Content: We travelled independently with two children and found this easy because of the central location. The boys loved using the trains to get around and only costing one Euro a real bargain! Hotel was stylish, clean and spacious. Breakfast was excellent, a good range of foods and plent to go around. We managed to see all that we came for in three days and were able to walk to some attractions from the Hotel. Good friendly and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: harrodsfan
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 5 nights in a noisy corner junior suite. Strange room with a small bedroom with a beautifully painted ceiling and another very small other room with a sofa bed. The closit/amroire was in the corner and very inconvenient. The headboard had an odd projection which made it difficult to read in bed without 4 pillows. While the location may be considered good as it is close to the train station, it is a very dirty, low end area. The bathroom was a decent size but poorly arranged. The bathtub had some mold around the caulking. The breakfast was ok but the breakfast room was on the top floor with a very slow elevator. t

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: john2492
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of May for six nights. We came here because we were at the hotel maikol for two nights at 120 euros per night. The palladium charged us100 per night with breakfast. Beware of the room switch as described earlier. When i came to the hotel asked for rates and to look at a room, they showed a much nicer and more spacious room than the one we got. What we got was nice, but the AC did not work for one night, which wasnt the end fo the world, it would have been in July or August. The staff was OK, hotel internel worked about half of the time. It is best to just to to one of the local vendors to use phone and internet at very competative prices. The hotel is in a great location, do not miss the Santa maria Maggiore church which is on the square about 100 yards left out of the hotel entrance. There is also a great cafeteria/restaurant on the square, one wine I did remember was Moretti Montelpuciano de Abruzzo for 14 euros-amazing. The hotel is close to everything you'll want to see in Rome, as well as trains if you are on Eurail pass

Reviews.Title: “Rome Termini”
Reviews.Author: govinda1
Reviews.Content: The Palladium Palace hotel is walking distance - about 25 yards-from the train and bus termini. Very convenient. Friendly helpful staff, good working breakfast - not much variety, but what the heck , you have good budget restaurants all around. Rome's China town is also nearby. Very good place to stay if you want to visit Rome on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Careful on the switch and bate with the room rate”
Reviews.Author: CarolTvlAgent
Reviews.Content: It has been quite a long time since my unpleasant experience with the Palladium Palace Hotel, but I just had to get the word out again. Then in reading current reviews, I see they pulled the same trick with other guests. I made reservations for clients to stay at the Palladium Palace with their family. This required two double rooms and one triple room. When they arrived they said they had to go into a larger room to accommodate and pay the higher rate. I had this rate all settled prior to their arrival and I was shocked when the clients returned with their receipt for the higher rate. I went back and forth and the hotel said the client agreed to the room and they were not going to refund the difference. I ended up paying the client the $300.00 difference. Even though this is years later I vowed to never book the Palladium Palace Hotel. I felt this would some day come back to them and they would lose business because of it. With all the hotel choices in Rome, look elsewhere for your lodging needs. In the end, they will feel the results in the pocket book.

Reviews.Title: “Who are those people who liked this hotel??”
Reviews.Author: Guest0987
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel. I think I would better have chosen 2* nearby. I was really disappointed, it was the worst hotel in our trip. Single room was tiny, very tiny. Very noisy because of the traffic outside. Terrible shower, either cold or hot, by your choice. But worst of all was the smell in the bathroom... disgusting. Double room was much better and really spacious but had the same problem with smell and noise. Absolutely terrible breakfast. Undrinkable coffee, dirty tableware, almost nothing to eat. The rooms were clean enough... I must admit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely spacious room”
Reviews.Author: sbstitcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night prior to leaving Rome for a cruise. The hotel was located a few minutes walk from Termini Station and about a 15 min walk fromthe ruins and the Collesium. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a great variety and was very good. the room was spacious and clean. We were amazed over the large size of the bathroom We enjoyed our stay and would stay again when returning to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service”
Reviews.Author: Marijamalta
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Rome. This hotel is simply excellent and great. It is really situated in a great location near the termini station and close to all amneties. The hotel personnel are very helpful. The rooms are very clean. I really had great time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing..... not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: Other than the location and being 2 short blocks away from Roma Termini and the polite hotel staff, I don't have anything positive to say about our stay at this hotel. We booked a 2 night stay and upon check-in on our first night, a "problem" presented itself which required us to be put up in another hotel 4 blocks from this hotel. We got our room the next day and although we appreciate getting a quiet room in the back, the room was dark, beds were not comfortable, and we felt the hotel website did just a fine job of marketing and that's it. We also bought a code for the hotel's wi-fi service, which was expensive (15 euros for 5 hours), slow, and just felt ripped off. Buyer beware! We didn't try their breakfast as we had a train to catch the next morning at 6:22am. Breakfast is served starting at 7am. This is our 4th hotel in Rome. If you want a nicer hotel in the Termini area, consider staying at the Best Western Hotel Universo. That is more like a 4* hotel although 4* in Italian standards is more like a 2.5* in the USA. Won't be coming back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - But thats about it!”
Reviews.Author: lil_punjabi_angel
Reviews.Content: So me and my two friends decided to go to Rome for a friends birthday. We chose this hotel after reading the comments on trip advisor. We booked directly with the hotel and chose a triple room. The total tarriff was very good 390 euros for three nights + b/fast. Location: This is best thing about the hotel by far!! The hotel is less than a minute walk from Roma termini, and it seems as if the whole of Rome revolves around this station. You can catch a bus/train to nearly all places. And all the tour buses also start from the station. We took a taxi from Ciampino airport to the hotel, this cost 50 euros (with the meter down). However I would strongly recommend saving some money and just taking the coach which runs between the airport and termini (every 1 hour and takes about an hour and costs 4.50 euros). CHECK IN: Now this is where some of the issues begun. The gent at the desk was very polite and gave us our room cards promtly without much hassle. He then asked us for our passports to take a photocopy. We handed our pasports to a lady on the desk. We waited for a few minutes, expecting her to take a copy and hand us back our pports. After a few minutes, I asked her whether she was finished with them or not, to which she very rudely said 'come and collect them in five minutes'. What made this women think that we'd leave an important document like a passport with a complete stranger in a new country, especially as she could have taken a copy while we were waiting. So we reluctantly left for our room without our passport. My friend then called reception and asked for the pports to be sent to our room. After a few minutes they did which was a huge relief! ROOM: ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BED SHEETS. When we arrived in our room the sheets were fresh thank God, however during our three night stay our sheets were not changed even once! When we returned to our room after a long day we found our room very clean, however the bed sheets hadn't been changed. I called reception and the man stated 'sheets; one day yes, one day no'. OK fair enough. The next night we checked again and they hadnt been changed, so we called again, this time a different gent says he cant do anything about it but speak to the boss in the morning. Upon checkout I mentioned this to the lady (yes the passport one), she said the boss wasn't here and she couldn't do anything about it neither. I find this absolutely unacceptable. The room itself was good, enough space for three of us and our luggage. BREAKFAST: Breakfast was BASIC but that didnt bother us, it was the quality of the basic breakfast which was really dissapointing! The bread felt like it had been out for days - it was so crunchy you would'nt have to toast it! The coffees dispensed by the coffee machine were the worst I had ever tasted!. The scrambled eggs looked and tasted disgusting. The only good thing was the salami and the choice of yoghurts. In summary I would say that the hotel itself is good, the room/bathroom/location are everything a first time visitor to Rome can want. However its the servive and the people's attitude which lets this place down. Would I stay here again? - probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: TNtwosome
Reviews.Content: Our group of three adults recently stayed at this hotel during a 4 day vacation visit to Rome. All of us enjoyed the Palladium Palace as a quiet place to relax & unwind after each day of sightseeing. The location of the hotel is one of its top features- about 5 minutes walk to Termini Station where we used the trains & metro during our stay. There were plenty of quality restaurants & pizzarias nearby, as well as a supermarket. It is within walking distance of several major attractions, but we generally hopped on the metro for the historic areas, the Vatican and the Borghese. We had pre-booked a couple of tours- These met us at & returned us to the hotel with no problems due to its location on a main sreet. Hotel staff was very courteous & helpful from the front desk & porters to the maids working upstairs. Directions when requested were clear & correct, and as Americans on our first visit to Rome, this was greatly appreciated. The room was spacious for the 3 of us- very clean & comfortable. Beds were great. We had a balcony view of the street- busy but not too noisy & a great view from the small balcony. The bathroom was well appointed with plenty of hot water. The rooftop morning breakfast was very good with a variety of rolls & pastries, meats, cheeses, cereals, fruits, juices, scrambled eggs- More than enough to eat and the quality was great. Our overall experience was very favorable. We were looking for a clean, comfortable, safe, centrally located hotel- the Palladium Palace surpassed our expectations and we would recommend it to you without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: How_Are_Things
Reviews.Content: Affordable, great location, lovely service, lovely rooms. Would definitely stay there again, and comes recommended from two 27 year olds.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MartinLA
Reviews.Content: Literally less than 3 short blocks from Termini train station I booked this hotel for 3 nights just 3 weeks before leaving, after reading Tripadvisor reviews on it, and the original Hotel Diana I canceled for the same reasons. In 2001 we stayed at Diana, but it appears to have gone downhill since, and after walking by it, I was really glad I switched to the Palladium. The latter gave us a 5th floor room on the street with a mini balcony window which when opened afforded views to the left to St Maria Maggiore dome and to the right to Termini station, with vibrant street life below, with plenty of hawkers selling umbrellas and stuff. When closed, the room was completely quiet until 6.30am when you could vaguely hear chairs being moved in the breakfast room on 6th floor. Complimentary bottled water in the mini bar, in wall safe, great bathroom, and rather a large room for Europe. 2 euro per half hour internet PC. Reception staff great and very friendly. We walked everywhere from here...Collosseum, Trastavere, Via Veneto, Barbarini, Trevi, Pantheon, Navona, Fiori, Villa Borghese. If you are arriving or leaving by train this is a very handy place to stay. We arrived from Paris on overnight train, and went to Naples and back between our first 2 and last day here. And then to FCO on the Leonardo Express. This seems far more worthy of 4 stars than its rating to us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value welcoming base to stay in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: brightonbreezy007
Reviews.Content: As most off you will find, city centre hotels in Rome are generally more expensive than other cities in Europe. I had thoroughly researched where to stay and found The Palladium palace good value for money. We had oringinally booked the standard double room at 175 euros a night direct with the hotel, but the owner made a mistake and we ended up with one of the superior rooms which should have been 235 a night. This was not bought to light until we checked out and received the bill, but the owner kindly honoured our reservation at the lower rate. Our room was 505 and had three balconies (it is at the top floor of the accomodation level), with even one off from the bathroom. The balconies were dual aspect and on both sides of the hotel so we had marvelous views down three different streets. The windows have shutters as well as the glass doors so sound is blocked out really well. The bathroom was designed with Versace tile and had a jaccuzi bath and a lovely powerfull shower. (no showergel in with the toiletrees, which seems common place with alot of hotels nowadays). Everything was clean and the beds were huge, as was the room. The breakfast was what we expected, with most things you need and I dont think you can complain when it is included in the price. The fresh pastries were delicious and most had surpise fillings, my favourite being coconut paste. The bars were always empty but there are great bars on every street with more atmosphere. The surprise was how reasonable the mini bar was in the room , a bottle of prosecco was only 3.5 and wine 3 euros. I never normally use mini bars as they are such a rip off so it goes to show that if they are reasonably priced people might actually use them. The hotel is located in quite a touristy modern area but we were getting the train from FMC airport to Termini which is literally a stones throw away so is very convenient. Everything in Rome is walkable though from the location if you are mobile enough, and there is always something to see on the way to where you are heading. The trains run every half hour to and from the airport and only take half and hour so I def recommend this as a transfer. The hidden gem is the Church Santa Maria Maggiore along the street. Just go inside and you will see what I mean, it is stunning! The hotel recommended two restaurants, the best being Sa Tanca, a fantastic seafood and fish restaurant. I will write a review on this too. Also in the street parellel is a typical Italian restaurant Nuova Stella which is handy if like us you are arriving late and want something nearby. I would also recommend the Library which is currently number 1 in trip advisor rome restaurants. So, in general, if you want to push he boat out try room 505 otherwise, if you just want somewhere fairly central to lay your head and have a hearty breakfast before sightseeing then you cant go far wrong with The Palladium Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ScatmanGL
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Please ask the for the room not facing the city, noisy, also don't hope to get a room with jacuzzi, they charge 30 euros per night extra if you want it and it is not worth it. Great location and great breakfast. Easy to find. I recommend it to anyone who is going to ROME.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: star45
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Rome and I stayed at Palladium Palace for two nights. I had a nightmare experience with one of the front desk attendants after asking a simple question about charges for a phone call I made. I'm not sure if the hotel attendant had difficulty communicating in English, but this does not excuse his behavior. I called the front desk to ask if I had been charged for a phone call I made because I thought I might have incorrectly dialed the access number on my calling card. The front desk attendant told me that I had been charged, but kept saying that there was a way I could get the call for free. I wasn't sure if he was trying to say that I wouldn't have to pay for the call or if he was just trying to tell me how to use the access number. He told me to come down to the front desk with the calling card so that he could explain. I brought my wallet with me so that I could pay any charges. When I got to the front desk, I explained to him what I had done. But, he kept telling me that I was being charged because I did not "respect the process." I'm not sure what he meant by this. He kept asking me if I knew which country I was in. I told him I wanted to pay for the charges, but I did not like his tone and I wanted to speak to the manager. He said he was the manager. I then asked if I could speak to the owner. He said he was the owner. I knew he was lying. I told him that was fine and he should just charge my card. Rather than just swiping the card I handed him, he kept saying that he was tired of explaining things to me. I said that was fine and told him to charge me. Finally he charged me. But, after I got my receipt and walked away back towards the elevator, he followed me, saying he did not need my money. He pulled out a wad of cash from his pocket and waived it in my face and told me he had plenty of money. I asked why he had charged me if he did not need the money. He told me to come back to the register and he would give me my money back. He then pulled five euros out of the register and threw them at me, telling me I was the "stupidest person" he had ever met. I could not believe this was happening. Especially since there were several people in the lobby watching. Later, when I asked for his last name so that I could write it on a hotel business card, he took the card from me and threw it directly at my chest. I was wearing an open-neck dress. I was aghast. How could any hotel allow its employees to treat customers this way? The next morning I asked a different front desk attendant who the real owner was and left a letter for the actual owner. I have not heard back. Please spare yourself this type of treatment.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable treatment in the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Anna999Greece
Reviews.Content: No view, no dishes! Palladium palace is an average hotel, near to public transfer means. I would like to complain about the annoying behaviour of the personel at breakfast who were exremelly in hurry to take the dishes from the table before having finishing eating as they had told that the dishes are not enough for all the custemers! The information that there is view of the terrace where the breakfast is offered is misleadind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the little balcony”
Reviews.Author: MapAndCompass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palladium Palace in May 2008 in room 507. The room was clean and comfortable, with a built-in wardrobe on either side of the bed. Behind the curtains we found a small nook leading to windowed doors, behind which were tall shutters. Open the shutters, and there’s a small balcony from which you can look around. The bathroom was clean and included a hairdryer. The shower was small by American standards and it had water jets, which were more like a power wash than a soothing massage. The 6th floor of the hotel is home to the restaurant, where breakfast is served each day. Breakfast included cereals, milk and juices, meats and cheeses, scrambled eggs and bacon, breads and a toaster, an assortment of yogurts, coffee and teas, and fresh pastries. One day we actually saw the pastries being delivered from the bakery. We tried the custard-filled pastries, which were delicious. One evening in our room, we could hear chairs being moved in the restaurant on the floor above, supposedly people sitting down at a table, but otherwise we heard no noise from above or from the hallway. The desk clerks spoke English and were helpful when we needed to get a cab to Vatican City. Assorted newspapers were available in the lobby. Internet access was available for a fee, at a computer in a room off the lobby. Upon check-in, a porter showed us to our room and he carried my suitcase. The hotel is just two blocks from Termini, which is the central station for Rome’s train, bus and underground lines. The kebab shop on the same block as the hotel had great comfort food that you could either eat at the counter or take away. I ordered the 1/2 chicken and roasted potatoes, and it was both delicious and a bargain. There are plenty of other good restaurants in the area, especially Nuova Stella. It’s a great place for a romantic dinner or for a casual dinner with friends. One block away from the hotel is SMA supermarket, one level below the street. They had produce, groceries, health and beauty aids, etc. We had a pleasant stay and would stay here again on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: elguapo_8
Reviews.Content: Although 4 stars obviously has a different meaning in Europe than here in the US, the Palladuim Palance is clean, well maintained and includes a decent breakfast. Unless you're planning on spending the entire day in a hotel and not out touring Rome, then don't stay here. But if you are going to go out to the sights, you can't beat the Palladium's location. Its 2 blocks from Termini (the train/ subway/ bus station/ tour buses), so Rome is at your disposal. And at the end of the day, the hotel is comfortable for a good night's rest. As for the rates, the Euro is kicking butt right now so dont expect to get too much for your buck anywhere in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Pleasant Experience for a 1st Trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: FamilyIndiana
Reviews.Content: My niece, sister and I were planning the trip of a life time and I contacted my Timeshare company to book this and several other hotels around Europe. We were given a confirmation of 1 price the 1st night and then discount prices for the next 2 nights. Well, the 2nd day in Rome we were touring the Colossium and I stepped in a hole and broke my ankle. After calling an ambulance and going to the emergency room we finally got back to the hotel where they had the handicapped entrance blocked with plastic plants, I had to hop on one foot, I didn't have any crutches and they just stood and watched my sister and my niece try to help me hop up 2 steps to get to the elevator. When we checked out a day later, my sister and my niece were trying to get the luggage and me into a taxi and pay the bill so we could leave. After we left and got to our next destination, we looked at the bill and found that they had over charged us. We worked at trying to get me a flight home because I could not travel on one foot and when I got home the second week in August, I called my Timeshare people and asked them to help me recoup our money. The Paladium Hotel would not respond to them after several phone calls, e-mails, faxes, etc. They kept asking for copies of the bill, the confirmation, our receipt of what we paid and each time we would fax the same information with no response. We filed a claim and here it is April 1, 2008 and have gotten nothing. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. They don't honor their confirmed prices and they are not very helpful to someone new in their country who needed help.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough overall, but not blissful!”
Reviews.Author: ParisJane
Reviews.Content: We used TripAdvisor before booking and did find the hotel very clean, lots of hot water, well located, with a good breakfast buffet. On the down side was the unannounced scaffolding on the whole facade, meaning no light or view at all for the moment and no compensation either! And a heating system that could not be regulated at all. It must have been 30° Centrigrade in our room until we finally just opened the window wide to let the hot air out. Another guest at breakfast said she had the same problem and nnothing could be done.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: oupsss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very good location as far as attractions are concerned. Everything but the Vatican was in a walking distance. However you could take the metro line A, and in 6 stops, approximately 10 minutes, you are at the Vatican. Honestly, everything is in walking distance! Breakfast was adequate. tosts, bacon, eggs, cerials, honey, coffees etc. The stuff was very helpful amd the city map they offer is very clear and specific. For those, staying in the hotel for the next weeks please take notice that the hotel is being probably renewed in the front, so the windows do NOT open and even if you will open them there is too much dust entering the roon. they start the constructions at about 9.30-10.00 so if you intend to sleep more than that, forget it. The location is not as bad as i thought it would be. ok, its not a cosmopolitan location but is fine for tourists but to tell you the truth me and my boyfriend didnt stay out late, after 9.30, because we were too tired to do so. For smokers keep in mind that you cannot smoke in the hotel, it is absolutely forbidden

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trainhopper07
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was really nice and very clean.Very close to the train station. There was a great church right down the street. The staff was great in helping you find things to do. I will recommend to call all your tours in yourself when it comes to greyline tours. We had asked the front desk to call in our tour to Pompeii and we waited in the lobby for a hour for the bus to pick us up and they never did. The staff was sorry about the mix up and we were out our money and no Pompeii for our family. The next time we are in Rome maybe we will get to see it. So Nice staff just call all your own tours in yourself. Also great breakfast small but good varity.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl356
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with even lovlier staff. We had a room booked from the internet-turned out horrible. We happened upon this place and it was a good find. The location could not have been better. It was close to the train station which took you anywhere in Rome. My mother lost her passport and they were so helpful. They made calls for us, due to the language barrier, and told us where to go and what to do. They suggested great places to eat and sight see at. The rooms were small, but all the rooms in Rome are small. They were clean and very nice! Breakfast was great and abundant! Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “No worse value than the rest ?”
Reviews.Author: greg2302
Reviews.Content: Yes, first of all the location is fine, no problem with the area and easy walking to Colliseum, train station and via Corsa is about 15 minutes away. That said, I don't think the hotel offers good value for money, maybe that's just Rome in general. It certainly wouldn't be 4* rated at home. The rooms are nice enough, the staff are excellent, the breakfast is terrible ..... not much more to say really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Poodle-Girl-1973
Reviews.Content: We booked out 10th wedding anniversary trip only a few days before departure to this hotel based on reviews by TripAdvisor. The location was better than we expected, we were expecting seedy but this wasn't the case at all. Our transfer from Ciampano Airport (Bus Shuttle - 6 Euros each way) took us right past the hotel to the Termini where we walked from, literally a 3 minute walk. On arrival (2 hours before official checking in time) we were professionally greeted with friendliness and our room was ready for us. We were taken up by a most courteous 'bellboy' who explained that -1 was the gym/sauna and level 6 was the breakfast room/roof terrace bar. Onto our room, this was very compact yet very pleasantly decorated, unfortunately, after a particularly bad night's sleep we had to prop the bed up one side with books as we were definitely rolling out! (Room 311) This room is at the back of the hotel with views out to adjoining flats yet most peaceful, no traffic noise. Most of our time was spent out exploring. All sights are within easy reach. We didn't use either bus or metro during our time here, we walked EVERYWHERE! Colloseum, Paletine, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Vatican etc, sore feet due to the amount of pebble footpaths but we would not have seen half of Rome if we'd taken public transport. Found some lovely places to eat in little alleyways too, with quaint little shops also. I found breakfast a tad worthless yet hubby loved it! There was bacon, scrambled eggs, frankfurter sausage and toast available yet to my tasle all undercooked. Also available was various cold meats, hardboiled eggs and rolls, croissants with preserves, cakes and tarts. The coffee was stewed and fresh juice tasted extremely watered down. I would have preferred to have foregone breakfast and instead left a little earlier to have a slice of breakfast pizza from a quaint little street cafe! The hotel staff were all very polite and extremely helpful, expecially in directing us to a nearby eatery for dinner on the first night (Stella's) The meal was great, fettucine to start with followed by the most sumptious steak then tiramisu which was absolutely to die for!! We were disappointed on the first night that there was a wedding reception being held in the rooftop terrace bar, even though we weren't told we weren't allowed up there, we walked in then quickly out again after feeling we were intruding. The only other thing we were a bit miffed at was the fact we'd put out our 'do not disturb' notice out before going to bed on the Friday night for a maid to walk in at 9am on Saturday morning, ok she was most apologetic but still, it shouldn't have happened.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Buffy13
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palladium Palace is located about 1 1/2 blocks from Termini in one direction and 1 1/2 blocks from Santa Maria Maggiore in the other direction. It is also near one of the stops for the "hop-on hop-off" buses (across the street from Termini). Several moderately-priced, but charming, sidewalk eateries a half-block away. The hotel serves a wonderful buffet breakfast in a charming roof garden. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We were very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: suz2john
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two couples. We needed something close to the train station and we stayed here in 2004 and found it a good location. The staff here was great - friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. (They could use free internet access.) Breakfast was wonderful. Couldn't ask for more. Great place - we'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: JuggaUK
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights at palladium palace last week. amazingly close to the termini train station. were greeted at reception on arrival by very friendly and multi lingual staff. shown to the room by a very friendly porter. the room was a decent size and very clean and nicely decorated. tv in the corner with a decent choice of channels. air conditioning worked perfectly. staff were very helpful on giving advice on local attractions and restaurants. breakfast in the morning was included, and was very tasty. room and en suite was cleaned perfectly every day. check in and check out was very quick and easy. we would like to thank all the staff at Palladium Palace for making our stay in Rome such a pleasant one. all in all a brilliant stay at this hotel and i would recommend this hotel to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCreasy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon in 2003. It was a fantastic hotel! The bathroom was unbelievable and the service was great. We both loved the breakfast every morning in the basement. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: OkieMo55
Reviews.Content: My party of 4 found everyone at the front desk most helpful. The hotel is located 3 blocks from the Termini station making rail and metro access easy. The breakfast had a wide variety of food and there are several good resturants nearby. The room was clean and of sufficient space for 2 people. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “no problems”
Reviews.Author: pompiousjulius
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through the "Last Minute Hotel" kiosk at the Termini for a one-night only stay as we had an early flight the next morning. It was perfectly fine. The room was CLEAN and there always seemed to be someone around if you needed help. It's not a luxary hotel, but we paid a reasonable price and I was happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this hotel like the plague”
Reviews.Author: enrolove
Reviews.Content: well, where can I start? this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed so far. All I can say is this is a CRAZY hotel with SHOCKING receptionist!!!! Firstly, on the day we arrived, the room was not ready and the guy at the reception was not friendly at all, no smile and basic greetings. We booked this hotel through lastminute.com with a package which included breakfast, but the receptionist insisted that our booking is not included with breakfasts, so my husband showed him the recipts with details,but apprently it was not good enough, that he still didn't believe it, and after checking on his own computer, he only said " right, breakfast is included" (no apology). 2ndly, the hotel brochure on the recption desk says all rooms has a bathtub, which is not true, room 209 doesn't have one and the towels in the bathroom smells. 3rdly, the next morning when we were having breakfast, a young lady came over, rudely grabbed my husband and said "NO breakfast for your room!" so we had to explain to her, she then went away to check it herself, but never came back to send an apology for her rudeness. later on this lady came over and put a egg shell bucket on our table, I don't know if she did it on purpose or not, but when she put it down, she actually banged it against the table, it was very loud, and even hit my cutlery! she walked away without saying anything.(what a suprsie~) All the things I mentioned above, I could have let it go, and stay quiet. but what happened next is just out of my limitation!!! I bought a new pair of Crocs sheos in the UK 1 week before we went to Italy, and on our 3rd day, I decided to wear another pair of shoes which I bought the day before. so I put my Crocs shoes in the new shoe box and a bag, but when I came back in the evening, it was gone. My husband and I went down and speak to another receptionist Dario, explained what happened to him, he phoned the cleaning lady and confirmed that it has been THROWN AWAY!! He gave us a piece of A4 paper to write down what has happened so that he will pass on to his manager the next morning when he comes in, but then he said we will have to email the manager ourself when we get back to the UK, just to make sure that the manager has received this piece of paper, which means we will have to follow up the compensation procedure ourself. He also mentioned that usually they will report to their insurance company and it will take at least 1 month to get the money refund to the customer. Right from the point he confirmed our shoes was thrown away like a rubbish by their cleaning lady there was not a sorry from his mouth. My husband and I took the paper upstairs, wrote down what has happened, and discussed that we should tell Dario that we felt quite uncomfortable of how this issues was handled. So after given him back the A4 paper, my husband said " I have wrote down what has happened but also I would like to give some feedback as we felt the whole thing wasn't handled nicely. Firstly the hotel has not apologise after confirming our shoes was thrown away, and even though we understand your hotel's insruance policy works in a certain way, but taking 1 month to refund the money to international guests is a bit unreasonable, it feels like the hotel is not taking responsibilities of it, and it's our bad luck that this has happened..." before my husband can finish Dario agitatedly interrupted " WOW~WOW~WOW~NO!ＮO!NO!I didn't say it's your bad luck ( but we didn't say you said it, we just said the way the hotel handles it makes us FEEL like it), I sent my man downstairs to check, and I called the cleaning lady for you( but isn't that what you are supposed to do anyway??), you can't say that to me, that is NOT right, it is an insult! You have offended me ( what?!)" I tried to interrupted to explain that we didn't say he said such words like " bad luck", but he cut off my talk again " WAIT! listen to me, let me finish my talk (wow.. all righ..)" he continued " and regarding the refund policy, if you go to any other hotels in the world, you will get the same solution.." he could be right, we might get the same solution but definitely different attitude!!! he went on and on, and after giving a lecture to us, he picked up his phone, and ignored us totally. So can't believe it!!! I just don't understand why it is so hard for the staffs in this hotel to say sorry????!!!!! When we got back to the UK, we emailed the manger, and received a reply, apologised for the lost shoes, and said he left a message to the receptionist to return our mony in cash, but they must have forgotten. He then asked us for the our bank account details so that he would transfer the refund to us, which we have emailed him with detail one month ago, but had no reply from him since then. This really is the WORST hotel experience we have had so far in our life, and don't think we would get anything worse than this!! If you don't want to ruin your holiday, stay anywhere else but here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok- Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaJoe
Reviews.Content: It was an ok HOTEL- the staff was not that friendly. We asked for a recommendation where to eat and the man seemed aggravated with us. Also the room was super small and OLD- I thought it was a bit over price for what it had to offer. I will not stay here again! There are way too many good choices to pick from in ROME that this one is not all that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Vlad_thetraveladdict
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Italy, leading a group of 43 people (mostly Americans and some Bulgarians). Our first stop was Rome and, luckily, Palladium Palace Hotel. First, the reservation desk person (Tiziano) was extremely helpful all along for our group accommodation. He is a true professional with excellent communication skills. Second, when we arrived, we discovered that the staff working at Palladium is absolutely superb - kind, caring, and very friendly. None of my clients had any concerns. My students even wanted to be photographed with some of the hotel's employees like Stefano. The picture is enclosed. We all had a wonderful experience. Third, breakfast was very good by Italian (and French) standards (if not German). The breakfast room is a very pleasant roof-top place. Finally, the location of the hotel is excellent, right next to Santa Maria Maggiore. All of central Rome is within an easy reach. We walked everywhere. I have been to Rome at least 10 times and this hotel has been our best experience so far.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: chazzy19
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at the Palladium Palace hotel. The whole experience was great from start to finish. The staff are excellent and very helpful. We stayed in a superior room which is well worth the extra cost. Beautifully decorated and tasteful furniture. Breakfast was very good, great selection of hot and cold food, something to suit everyones tatse. The hotel location was perfect, so many of the main attractions including the Colloseum, Pantheon, Trevi fountain and Spanish steps only a 20 minute walk away. All in all a prefect place to see the true beauty of this magnificent city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Bad Insurance Policy”
Reviews.Author: darceyNi
Reviews.Content: This place has up sides and down sides. Location - Up - Very handy to the main train station/ Down - sleazy and a bit scary at night. Up - a short walk to some great restaurants/supermarkets/churches-check your maps anything north west is promising. The rooms were lovely. Yes, small - but inviting. Unfortunately we were broken into as we slept and all of our valuables/money were stolen. We were treated very well by the hotel staff (ie taken to the police station and offered a move to another room etc) We loved the hotel and despite what happened we would return if not for the fact that we still have not been reimbursed for the money/valuables stolen. We stayed early October 2006 - as I write it is Feb 16th. So - we will keep you posted and let you know whether the upsides outweigh the downsides!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Beds”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer500
Reviews.Content: Following advice from other Trip Advisor reviewers confirming that this hotel was a decent place to stay, we booked this hotel. However, we found the the general area unsavoury, the rooms small, and more importantly, the bed in the room was filty and FULL of dust mites. I developed a terrible rash. This is unacceptable. I would never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: FotosDelMundo.info
