Reviews.Content: This was really a great hotel, especially for the price. I was pleasantly surprised. It ranks as one of the best values I have had for a hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the hotel is clean, well kept up, and quiet, and the room was nice and comfortable as well. I had no complaints. They even gave me a Rome tourist book when I arrived (not just a pamphlet, but a detailed book filled with color photos of what to see.) The hotel is conveniently located near the train station which makes it easy to get to from the airport. It's not too far from the Colosseum and many of the ancient ruins of Rome. It is farther from other Rome sites and Vatican City, but if you don't mind walking a little, you can still walk. There are also city buses that run frequently around the city, most of which go to the train station. A great option for getting around from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good price-quality relation”
Reviews.Author: Ulick
Reviews.Content: About the location: To be honest, the hotel is not located in the glamurous Via Venetto. It is not situated in a romantic square near Navona either. It is in Esquilino, in a boisterous street, full of low category shops and shabby restaurants . But certanly, the location has its advantages. In first place, the hotel is very close to TERMINI train station, which means that it is well communicated with the airport and with other cities. It is also close to the METRO, and there are many BUSES to any part of the city. On the other hand, in the Esquilino there are some interesting places, and you can get to many attractions in a quarter of hour walking. Nevertheless, it must be clear that the hotel is not located right in the middle of the historical centre. Rooms and services: Let s be honest again: This is not in the Intercontinental (some of the reviews could lead you to belive it). But I must say that the room we got was completly renovated and immaculately CLEAN. It was SPACIOUS as well. And so was the bath. The breakfast buffet was good enough. Must be noted that, although the windows were good quality, there was some NOISE at night from the street (buses and trams), so if you prefer a quiet room you would better ask for an interior one. The sauna and the gym are not included in the price. The internet facility in the room is expensive (but there are many “internet points” in the surroundings). In conclusion, I would say that it is an acceptable good hotel regarding its category and price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy near the train station”
Reviews.Author: RangeviewRay
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (about noon), were allowed to check in and given an upgraded room. The room was small by American standards but certainly adequate for a night or two considering that we spent every free minute out seeing the city. The front desk staff were polite, very helpful, and spoke English well. The hotel is about three minutes walk to the main train station (and subway line), which is why we chose it. We also walked from the hotel to the Coliseum (15 minutes) and other attractions like Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona (30 minutes). We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GPTS
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on trip advisor and wasnt disappointed and having just seen the review from London, they seem to be describing a different hotel to the one I recently stayed in. We booked a room for 2 nights which was spacious, clean and basically had everything you would need. Although a little expensive, we paid 414 euros, this is Rome and you would have to pay a lot more if you were staying right in the centre. The room faced the street which could be a little noisy if the window was open but when the window was closed, you could barely hear the traffic. It had air conditioning if you needed it. The bathroom was spacious, had a powerful shower, hairdryer, ample hair/shower gels which were replenished the next day. There was also a well stocked minibar. It would have been nice to tea/coffee making facilities in our room. I thought the breakfast was the best Ive had in Europe so far, plentiful with toast, scambled eggs, ham, cheese, croissants, pastries, fruit juice, etc. I found the staff very helpful, especially on reception and also the chambermaids/restaurant staff were cheerful and greeted you with 'Buon giorno' every morning. It was an ideal location being so close to the Termini and within easy walking distance from the main sites, being about 15-20 mins walk to the Trevi Fountain and Colleseum although we used the hop on hop on buses which were perfect for taking you to all the attractions especially the Vatican which would be a bit of a hike. We generally walked back to the hotel, getting lost sometimes but with a good map ( which incidently the hotel provides you with a book of maps and walks etc )eventually finding our way back. I noticed the buses especially nos 64 and 40 were packed solid so you had to be careful of pickpockets, but we didnt use them anyway. The area around Termini was fine, always quite busy so you never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel in the evening. There are a lot of street sellers who pounce on you if you so much as glance at their stalls. Dont buy water, etc from the street sellers as you can buy it a lot cheaper at a little supermarket just a few metres from the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the great location and when I return to Rome, I would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Staff at Palladium Palace”
Reviews.Author: piba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palladium Palace in Rome for five nights in September, 2006. The location is perfect for public transportation, a mere three blocks to the Termini Station for trains, metro, tour buses, etc. It is located a seniors’ walking distance to Palatine Hill, and other Roman tourist sites. The staff is courteous and helpful. They always knew exactly what to do and did it: locating our lost luggage, reporting lost credit card. They also gave detailed directions to locations and always had a welcoming smile. Our room was spacious, clean and the bathroom had a Jacuzzi shower, which was a treat for sore muscles. The facility and amenities are nice and the staff makes everything shine!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel In Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rocks9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal!!! It's two blocks away from Termini Station (the main subway station in Rome) and the hotel rooms and large and very clean. The only bad thing I have to say is that we asked to use the sauna and they didn't tell us that there was a 10 Euro charge per person to use it. When we were checking out they tried to charge us, but we complained due to their non-disclosure so they waived the fee. All in all, the rooms are great and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: traveldrp
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palladium Palace four times. We have always been pleased by the accomodations. The breakfast is varied enough and available at convenient times. The front desk staff have always been very accomodating. If you can request it, the fifth floor rooms have balconies!The location is great and we have walked to all locations for visitng, including the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay for family of 5 from NJ, USA Aug 10-14,2006”
Reviews.Author: B531
Reviews.Content: wonderful stay, very nice and spacious rooms, very clean..no shower curtain or door but ok. Good AC. Very nice breakfast and helpful front desk. Great location to the Termini station, area is fine, just avoid the station after 10 pm. Small grocery store and ATM machine a few doors down

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: ahs4y
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the reviews, as was not disappointed. Hardly a 2 minute walk from/to the Termini, this is a well-appointed hotel, in a safe area, with via Nazionale & Termini (as well as shops, restaurants etc.) within walking distance. The hotel is very small (as I found, all hotels are in Europe!), as is the room and bathroom, but very clean. Seemed remodelled recently as the room decor was very nice and new. The staff was friendly and helpful, and basically, you can't ask for more from a hotel with a reasonable price and a good location (safe during the day and late night). Breakfast was included but the usual bland, boring fare (not worth paying for). Shower was quite cramped and the drain was slow to work, but acceptable. Bathroom had a bidet as well, and the room had a safe and minibar (but bring water etc. in and use as a fridge!) One thing to note, if you want to get to the hotel from the Termini, make sure you get out of the Termini from the subway entrance/exit, and not from the airport express entrance/exit. We did the latter, and found it difficult (and a long walk) to get to the hotel. The subway entrance/exit is on the same road as the hotel, so that'll be easier. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Glad to be detoured here!!!”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: We were re-directed here after arriving at Hotel Hiberia to find out they lost power. We were upset at first (since we had reservations and planned our trips to start from that original location), but once we arrived at the Palladium Palace, their understanding and quick service was refreshing. We were upgraded to a better room free of charge and it was very large and romantic. Our window faced the back of another room, but was OK since there was excellent AC and it kept the noise level down to almost non-existent. The bathroom was an odd long shape, hard to maneuver but very nice. Breakfast was way better than expected. Staff was very helpful with giving maps/directions and recommendations for restaurants. In the end, the location was not that bad. 10-15 minutes walk to Colosseo and Forum de Roma.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel that is reasonably priced for Rome, within easy walking distance to Termini station, has a pleasant staff, and a very good breakfast. The hotel is only about 2 blocks from the main railroad, bus, and subway station, making it easy to get to any part of Rome served by mass transit, which includes most of the major tourist sites. The neighborhood is not the best, but I’ve seen worse. If you’re only used to middle or upper income areas then I can see why you would be put off by the area and the noise level. I walked safely around outside at night and had no problems with level of noise inside the hotel or out, but my room was not facing the street either. The hotel itself seemed safe and secure with someone always at the front desk. The staff was courteous and very helpful. They serve an excellent breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs and toast in a very nice terrace room on the top floor, that is also used as a bar in the warmer months. I spend four nights in a single room in late May, the room by American standards was very small, but typical for Europe. The room was clean and had a nice little bathroom with a very small shower stall, but this again is typical for Europe. The only thing that keeps me from giving the hotel a top rating is my bed was not very comfortable for some reason. I think it tilted to one side slightly, just enough to effect my sleep. I just stuffed some newspapers under the mattress on one side and that seemed to make a world of difference. I would say this hotel deserves more then a 2 star rating. It’s reasonably priced, with a great central location, and good services. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: orbops
Reviews.Content: We were redirected here after the Hotel Doria informed us that they did not have a room with running water for us. The hotel is only about 2 blocks from the train station, so it was in a perfect location to catch the train the following morning when returning to the airport. We were impressed with the hotel and believe that it should be rated higher than 2 stars. The room was nice and clean, and the beds were softer than the other 2 hotels we stayed at during our vacation in Rome/Pompeii. They serve a very nice breakfast on the 7th floor in an enclosed roomtop setting. The room was spacious, and the bathroom was the largest one during our stay in Rome and Pompeii. The only problem with the bathroom was that the bathtub/shower did not have a curtain, so water went all over the floor while taking a shower. It was a little noisy from the street, but died down at 10PM - nothing different than any other hotel. They also had a workout room which we didn't use due to all the walking we were doing in the area. Overall a fine place to stay if you need to go back to the airport the next morning. One nice little feature was the ability to set a wake up call from the TV!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a fairly cheap (for Rome) hotel in a central location this is a pretty good bet. We had a good sized room, the bed was comfy and the bathroom (bath and shower) was huge. The hotel was clean and felt secure, with staff at the front desk all night. The area a block or two up from the hotel isn't the best, and I didn't feel comfortable walking there at night - but, that said, there's very little reason to do so unless you're coming direct from Termini, so don't be too put off by this. Only slight downside of the hotel itself was that the plumbing was rather noisy and the walls rather thin!

Reviews.Title: “More than a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 19 year old son and I just returned from a 6 night stay here. The hotel is much better than the 2 star rating that Trip Advisor gives it. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would suggest a room away from the street, on the back side of the hotel. There wasn't much of a view (apartment buildings) but it was very quiet. The location was ideal. Walking distance to most of the sites, or a short walk to the terminal to catch a bus for 1 eur most all of the sites. I would stay at this hotel again if I every get back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “adequate”
Reviews.Author: TravelPebble
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during honeymoon last year. Probably would opt to stay in a less noisy part of the city next time. Room was noisy, both in terms of outside and inside noise. There were about a million people staying in the room next to us, and everytime someone came or went, our door and windows rattled. DVD didn't work. Management tried to fix several times without success. They just kind of gave up. Front desk was very friendly. I didn't find the neighborhood scary. Bed was only moderately comfortable. I didn't hate it, but I probalby wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to walk to some areas but also for jumping on the metro and f”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel good value for money, good location for metro and terminal station. Very clean hotel and friendly staff. Good choice of breakfast for everyone in the rooftop room. We thought it may have been nice to have had tea and coffee facilities in the room. Can be a bit noisy at night if you don't shut your windows and shutters. Romans love to sound their horns!Would use the hotel again if I went back, ask for a balcony room perhaps!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great”
Reviews.Author: TravelsWithMonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights in Feb 06. Reception staff were just about friendly on arrival but best described as civil after that. We were given a first floor room which had a very clean and fully featured bathroom attached, but both were very small by any standards. Aircon didn't work but it was February - turning the heating off and leaving the window open for 20 minutes sorted out the heat issues. On asking, we were told bluntly that the Internet didn't work and no suggestions were offered. Breakfast was decent (cereals, pastries, meats, toast juices and teas and coffee) up on the 6th floor in a bright and airy room. There's a lift which you will use after you've tried walking it just once... Location is excellent - a short walk from Termini train station so easily reachable from the airport, and we found that everywhere in the City was reachable on foot, even Vatican City, though we used the Metro to get there on a couple of occasions. All in all, good location, clean, there are bigger rooms than the one we were given, decent breakfast, they will keep your bags after you check out until you need to leave for the airport, and they give you a little guidebook recommending sights. If you don't need smiles from the reception staff this place will serve you well. Fair value for a clean place with breakfast at a touch under £40pppn.

Reviews.Title: “reviews well deserved”
Reviews.Author: 96adrian
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel for a romantic weekend because of the reviews on tripadvisor, and i wasnt disapointed. its not in romes most glamourous area but everything is only a short taxi ride away, and when we arrived the front door was opened and we were allowed to check in at 11am and our bags were carried to our room. To the polish girl and her italian boyfriend who ran the bar upstairs thanks for your friendliness and advice, because i know you read this website!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights 10 to 13 Dec 05. This hotel is very close to the Termini. It really is an above average hotel which is very clean, comfortable and cosy with pleasant,helpful and courteous staff. Our bathroom was exceptionally clean with a heated towel rail and a very efficient hairdryer. The TV did only have one English speaking news channel but there was the odd English speaking film in the evening. Breakfast, which is taken on the 6th floor, is slightly more than a basic continental breakfast and is well presented. Howerver, there is one thing that lets this hotel down - there is no tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms. Although nothing is a trouble for the staff it would have been nice to be able to put the kettle on for a cuppa first thing in the morning and this would have made all the difference for me. As other reviews state the Termini area is not the best area, but we didn't feel threatened in anyway. The benefits here are that you are not going to pay way over the odds for drinks and food as we did in the Vatican area. We also had the dearest cheese toastie and coffee in the most expensive street in Rome but weren't aware of this until after the event so check things out first! We had two days sight seeing using the hop on hop off open top buses (the red ones). Tickets cost 13 euros per person and can be purchased from the Termini or on the bus if you get on at one of the sights. These run about every 10 minutes and have ear phones for commentary of the sites. I would not hesitate using this hotel again. The only thing left to say is enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palladium Palace for two nights on a site-seeing trip. We were allowed in before check-in time to an extremely comfortable and clean room. Cannot fault the hotel in anyway with regard to cleanliness and comfort. Staff were polite and helpful. We were not expecting breakfast to be included but were pleasantly surprised to find there was a breakfast room on the 6th floor which offered an extensive range of food from ham, eggs, pastries, toast, yoghurt, fruit juice, tea and coffee again in very pleasant clean surroundings. Set near most of the tourist attractions there was slight noise from the traffic and trains at night, however after touring the City all day, we slept at night with no problems at all. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked on net after reading other reviews. Hotel was excellent, very clean, staff always pleased to help and offer assistance or advice on booking tours, or arranging transport to and from airport. Geography is good, near major tours office,main tram lines and main station which is also part of the metro. Would definateley use again or recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, I had my doubts... I was hoping for a comfortable stay. We paid €165 for a night and we stayed here 6 nights.. and I must say it is as good 3* star hotel as you can expect! nice and central(you can walk to almost all the major attractions) 1min walk to Termini. Helpful and freindly staff. big clean rooms nice big bathroom. The breakfast was not the best, but far from bad. Rome is not the cheapest place to be, and for this price I will recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a comfortable romatic stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected From Reading Previous Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Shamu63
Reviews.Content: It was with some trepidation that we entered the Palladium after reading a number of other reviews on Trip Advisor. I am pleased to say that I could not find fault with the hotel, staff or the immediate surroundings !! Arrived around noon (which is before the normal check-in time) but we were checked in with no problems. Allocated room 504 which is on the top floor and overlooks the side street. I believe this may be one of the upgrade rooms as it had a small balcony that overlooked the street, although we didn’t actually ask to be upgraded, and weren’t told that we had been. Couple of lifts to take you to your floors, only big enough for 6 people, but never had to wait too long for them. Large room, with double bed, small sofa (spare bed), dressing table, satellite TV and large wardrobe. Bathroom was adequate, with toilet, bidet, sink and large massage style shower (no bath). The rooms were clean and tidy, cleaned everyday with fresh towels each day if required. Also had air conditioning, which was a godsend as the temperature outside was stifling. As stated in other reviews the area around the hotel is not the best, but it’s also not the worst. I have been to a lot of capital cities where things around the hotel was considerably more salubrious. Hotel is equidistant fro the Termini Train station and the Piazza Santa Maggiore (which is a wonderful church to walk around and view the painted frescoes on the ceiling, not the Cistine Chapel, but well worth a look). 15 – 20 minute walk to the Coliseum , and the same to the National Monument. To be totally honest it’s not that far to a lot of the famous sights that would be on most people’s tour itinerary. Be warned though that your feet will eventually give up due to the cobbled streets ! Breakfast room is on the top floor (sixth). breakfast is continental style, with fruit juices, teas, coffee, bread, meat, cereal, toasting facilities. Never had a problem with the food running out or getting a table. Totally acceptable. The ever so helpful guy behind reception recommended us a couple of restaurants. Giovanni’s, which is out of the hotel, turn right and two blocks up on the right. Nice food, wine drinkable, pleasant staff and decent prices. The second (can’t remember name), out of hotel, turn left and the first street over the main road on the right. Ask at reception, they seemed only too willing to help. I can understand people’s qualms about the noise from the road, but what you have to take into consideration is the hotels front does face onto one of the main roads in the city, and after all, you’ve got to expect some noise seeing as you are in a capital city ! Yes there is road noise but it didn’t disturb us too much, and on certain occasions there is rumbling from the train station. If you’re a light sleeper maybe not the place to stop. All in all, very pleasant hotel, well worth the money paid, and would definitely stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rate it average”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palladium Palace at the end of June for our four-night stay in Rome. We booked it online primarily because of the price and since we didn't know much about Rome, because it was close to the train station. It was easy to catch a train from the Rome airport to Termini, the city's main train station. Proximity to Termini can't be beat, the hotel is only a five minute walk away. We did go there to take the subway and catch taxis so no complaints there. It's within walking distance of the Colosseum and that was a bonus. There are a couple of decent restaurants nearby and although it's not the nicest neigborhood in the world, we never felt unsafe. Our room and bathroom were spacious with good air/con. The downside is the noise. Every bus and truck in the city must go by the hotel -- our room would literally vibrate at all hours. We were on an upper floor so the actual noise wasn't too bad but you were always conscious of the traffic. Perhaps some of the rooms on the back side of the hotel don't have this problem. We only ate breakfast at the hotel once -- very standard fare and so we chose to eat more interesting meals elsewhere. Front desk staff -- one guy was totally unfriendly and unhelpful; the other was pretty friendly but we didn't depend on him for information. Having seen other parts of Rome I don't think we would stay here again but would find a place closer to a more interesting neighborhood and activities. But if you're looking for a clean, relatively inexpensive and safe place to stay, then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked”
Reviews.Author: rambles
Reviews.Content: we booked a room online with the hotel, which was prepaid. When we arrived, we were informed the hotel was overbooked and they arranged a room at an 'equivalent' hotel-we were given no choice. The alternate hotel looked unrated, and was quite unacceptable. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not for 1st time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: wackyjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 10 - 13, 2005. The lobby is small, as is the elevator. The room was a good size and very clean. So was the bathroom. Our room overlooked a noisy street and I had to wear earplugs at night to drown out the noise. (No a/c in May so the windows were open). The location was perfect for getting to transportation, and there were many small restaurants and cafes nearby, as well as a laundry. However, this was my first visit to Rome (which I really didn't like) and I think I should have stayed in a nicer area.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries In Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palladium is an absolute oasis in Rome. The hotel is just a short 5 minute walk from the Rome Termini rail station which is also the hub for all bus routes and Rome's metro system. This location puts you within minutes of any of the wonderful sights of Rome by being so close to the major forms of transportation in the city. There are several restaurants in the area to suit any price range and a wide range of shopping can also be found within a short walk. The hotel is beautiful, secure and well maintained. The rooms are extremly nice, clean, quiet, and full of all the amenities that you would want or need. I was particulary impressed with how quiet the rooms were for after being out and about in the city all day it was so nice to come back and enjoy some quiet time and relax....a true home away from home. The hotel staff are very knowledgeable about the city as well as other destinations within Italy and are very willing to help with recommendations on the best methods of getting around which can certainly save you time and money. I have experienced some of the famous travel gliches in my past travels to and from Rome and thanks to the wonderful staff at the Palladium they were able to assist me in getting around those gliches and get me on my way to enjoy the rest of my trip. To say the least, the staff are very friendly, professional and eager to make sure that your stay in Rome is full of only good memories. I highly recommend the Palladium Palace to anyone that wants to experience a worry free stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to the Pallidium. Each time the hotel gets better. Close to the Termini train station. Easy access to all public transport for the city. Friendly helpful staff. Great places to eat nearby. To top it off the rooms are quiet, comfortable, clean and spacious. While Rome itself can be loud crowded and hectic, this hotel is an oasis in the city. In the past we have taken groups of 5-7 friends with us on trips and whether we booked 1 or 5 rooms we got great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: ConcernedCitizen
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxurious hotel but for the price we paid - less than 100 euro a night including breakfast for two - I think it would be hard to find better value so central in Rome. The location is convienent, on the city centre side of Termini, a busy area but safe. The rooms were fine, very clean. Good sized bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast wasn't great (we got up late so maybe it was better early on) but there are plenty of alternatives in the area. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: sam30x
Reviews.Content: Immediate area around the hotel is a bit scruffy, but busy - so you feel quite safe. Lots of restaurents and snack bars. The Hotel itself is very clean, the staff are helpful and the buffet breakfast on the 6th floor is excellent. It's also a very good location for sightseeing. It's a very short walk to the Termini (metro, bus and train links) which means you can get around the city and region very easily. The Grey Line Tours office is just round the block (if you wish to add on a guided trip to Capri, Pompeii etc !) Important because some of the trips start quite early. I also used an outfit called Roman Odyssey for tours of the Roman Forum/Colosseum and the Vatican. Excellent!! You can get information on what they offer and prebook them on -------. (Try to get Susan as your guide - she really knows her stuff!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GOJStockport_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palladium Palace in March 2005. After booking the hotel I was alarmed to read in a guidebook that the area around Termini should be avoided but, encouraged by the many positive comments on Trip Advisor, we continued with the booking and were not disappointed. The hotel was spotlessly clean, five minutes walk from the station and very comfortable. We had a triple room which had a free safe and was on the inside of the hotel so relatively quiet. Most of the main attractions were within easy walking distance, we caught the Metro to the Vatican, very simple and just a euro each so very good value. The local area, though busy, did not feel threatening as there were always plenty of people around. Crossing the road was an eye opener as the cars do not stop if you wait at crossings, you need to stride out into the road and they will then stop for you. We found that to cross in the slipstream of a nun was the best way to build confidence! For a good value and convenient hotel with a substantial breakfast I can thouroughly recommend the Palladium Palace

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: biyahera
Reviews.Content: Stayed in HP for 2 days during the Pope's death and the location could have been any better. I was traveling alone and with a luggage and a carry on I would have taken a taxi and pay an arm and a leg. Since you can see the hotel as soon as you get out of the termini, its a short walk. Getting around by the metro or by bus is easy. The hotel staff was friendly and speaks English and they have someone to help you take your luggage to your room. I booked this hotel at the termini and I paid 80euros/night though I pre - booked it coz I arrived we a tour group then I extended my stay. Lucky for me coz they have jack their prices because of the demand. Would recommend it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for a first trip to Rome - Clean, Breakfast, Comfortable - Its Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: BobbyH
Reviews.Content: I would give the Palladium Palace an average rating. I stayed there during my first visit to Rome and was disappointed. It was comfortable and clean with an average free breakfast. The hotel offers 1-2 English TV Channels. (Not that any of us are traveling to watch TV in a different country) I would NOT recommend this hotel to someone visiting Rome for the first time. It is very close to the train station, which is nice if you are not staying in Rome and/or are traveling outside the city on the train. If your plan is to stay in the city and see the sites Rome has to offer I would recommend staying somewhere else. The hotel is within walking distance (a hike) of the Colisseum but not within comfortable walking distance of anything else. I would also recommend that visitors to Rome avoid the metro. While convenient it is also hot and packed. I think a Cab or Foot are the better options. So, if you are looking for a cheap place next to the train station, with an average breakfast the Palladium Palace is for you. If you are looking for a nice vacation spot in Rome look closer to the Vatican or Spanish Steps. There is nothing "neat" about the area surrounding the Termini. There is a lot of "fast" food and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “short walk from the Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: tourist05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palladium Palace at the beginning and the end of out trip to Italy in the first and third weeks of March 2005. We chose it based on Tripadvisor review comments, and were not disappointed. The front desk staff we dealt with spoke very fluent English, were always courteous, offered maps of the city and information on tours at check-in, and wake up calls and bus/subway transportation information as requested. The location of the hotel was very convenient, less than 5 minutes walk from the Rome Termini train and subway station, and about a 10-15 minute walk from the Forum and the Colloseum. The neighbourhood street traffic had an edge (noise, volume, intensity) to it but did not feel unsafe. The Leonetti restaurant just one short block away was recommended by the front desk as a good quality establishment, and their mixed grilled vegetables (appetizer) were among the best we had on our trip. The breakfast served on the 6th floor was extremely generous: boiled eggs, meat, cheese, fruit, bread, crossoint, cereal. fruit juice, cappucino. tea and hot chocolate. On sunny days we had a wonderful view of the city from up on high.Our room faced the main street and from the fourth floor offered a good view of the street traffic (usually very busy) . It was cold in Rome and we had the windows shut at night so we did not experience too much noise from the street although we could hear the streetcars and trucks. On our second visit, we had a room with a jacuzzi shower, and appreciated the luxury that it offered. We considered it very good value for the Euro 100 price we prepaid in US dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BanksyUk
Reviews.Content: Highly recomended if you don't want a taxi ride to your choosen hotel, as very close to Rail Station. Good qulity hotel as well. Good staff, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, good location for train travel”
Reviews.Author: RMoe
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Palladium Palace in August 2004. This was our first stop in our 10 day tour of Italy. We were extremely pleased with the hotel. The staff was great, the breakfast was basic but tasty (especially since it was included in the room rate), and the room was small but very comfortable and clean. We booked a triple and found the room just large enough to hold three twin beds. The bathroom was newly refurbished and nice. Since we were traveling by train, it was great to arrive at Statione Centrale and walk two blocks to the hotel. The area was not bad even in the evening. We would stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl1966
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Hotel Palladium Palace at the end of November and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Rome. Room was small but exceptionally clean, the staff was was friendly and very helpful (especially Paolo at the front desk). We found the Termini area busy but safe. All in all a great hotel at a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise trip was no shock!”
Reviews.Author: Jinkyhenke
Reviews.Content: I arranged a surprise birthday treat for my partner and booked the Palladium Palace after reading reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. An error in booking led to an immediate upgrade on arrival and profuse apologies. The staff could not have been more helpful and the accomodation was excellent. It's worth paying a little extra for a superior room. When we return to Rome it will be to this hotel which offers value for money in every respect without the need to compromise on quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HP in Rome for 3 nights and got a good deal through Expedia (cheapest I could find). Nice hotel, clean, tidy, warm with air-con if required, the room is a bit compact. Top notch service with nice friendly staff who gave us some good advice, complimentry tour guide and maps. Once we checked out (12pm), the staff were kind enough to store our luggage in a safe room for free so we could explore more of Rome as our flight was not till 7pm. The area is quite noisy (as expected) but we found the windows to be quite sound protective so a lot of the noise was cut out. There were a couple of English speaking channels including a film channel, MTV etc, all complimentry which was a welcomed treat after a long days walk. The area is not really seedy but it's not the most attractive part of Rome, non-threatening and we felt quite safe as we would normally get into the hotel at around 9pm/10pm. In the surrounding streets are some nice restaurants with reasonable prices and a supermarket down the road to pick up your food souvenirs. Very close to the station and Giobertti is a big street so you can't miss it, do not take the taxi as it is 2 mins walk from the Termini (Termini to FCO airport = 9.5 euros one-way). 10/15 mins walk from the Colosseum and (if you're up for it) half hour from the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain. The good thing was it was close to the bus station for easy travel to areas such as the Vatican, also you would find that a lot of buses, no matter where you were, would go back to the bus station. Recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Hotel Palladium from November 7 to 14. I like the hotel, it is 5 minutes walk from Termini Station - from Termini Station you can take the subway, bus or taxi to go to place you want. The place is not seedy as some of the reviewers mentioned. It is lively and noisy at night but that did not bother me or my sister. The conceirge were helpful. The breakfast were wonderful. I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Based on Tripadvisor comments, I spent three nights. Comments are very helpful and accurate. Close to train station, buses, trolleys and subways. Felt safe even at night; many people on the streets at all hours. Many other international guests and Italian military. Room small, but clean and quiet (not facing main street). Had CNN for news/weather in English. Rooftop garden breakfast room was very nice; good selection of cold cuts, cheese, rolls, breads, cereals, fresh fruit and COFFEE. If you like to walk and explore, everything in Central Rome is 30 minutes (Vatican maybe 45). GREAT VALUE. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased except...........”
Reviews.Author: syrus16
Reviews.Content: Overall good hotel - Staff was very nice extremely. One problem, our first night there, we we bumped to a hotel around the corner becuase there were no more rooms with two beds left. (I was with my dad, worst case we would have split it but....) He said we were going to a 4 star as the PP was a three star and that he would pay the difference. Turns out the Paladium Palace was nicer. Good breakfast each morning, good location depending on what you are doing. Not super close to center city, but right by the main station which goes to airport FCO (and good for us cause we were going to Naples from there) and has the two subway lines right there too. **NOTE - the area described as rugged, seedy and BAD by others surrounding the station, really isnt bad at all. Don't be turned away as this is where the cheapest rates are. Rooms were a bit small, but I hear that is the case all over Europe. Got best rate through either expedia or travelocity - dont remember, but paid 106 Euro for two nights in Nov. I def reccomend the Palladium Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend Hotel Palladium Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Palladium Palace Hotel at the August Bank Holiday weekend this year. It is a little out of the centre but the metro is close by. We preferred to walk so that we wouldn't miss anything and I had the blisters to prove it - so take decent walking shoes! The hotel reception staff are helpful, courteous and friendly. The breakfast is continental but buffet style so you can eat as much as you like. It's very close to Termini station and there are bus links to Ciampino airport. We flew with Thomsonfly from Coventry for £45 each and stayed at the Palladium Palace for three nights in a double room for £228. Excellent value for money. The room was clean with a shower over the bath, tv and fridge in the room and hairdrier in the bathroom. The drawback was no iron is provided and you aren't allowed to plug in your own. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLANT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: SWMBO23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip to Rome through AAA Travel....for our 20th wedding anniversary (my first trip to Rome). Our agent went outside the book and recommended the Hotel Palladium Palace. The hotel is wonderful!!! We spent a week there, and after seeing other hotels in Rome, this one is superp. Although the rooms are a bit small, you're only there to sleep anyway. It's been recently renovated, it's decorated in a lovely Italian style, it's very clean and well kept up, with maid service every day. They offer a complimentary, expanded, breakfast in a bright and cheery area, just what is needed to start your day of adventure off on the right note. The staff at the hotel are wonderful... helpful, pleasant and very professional. The hotel is located 2 blocks away from the train/bus/subway station (The Termini), which is quite convenient in order to get around and to see the wonders of Rome. It's also around the corner from the Green Line bus tour station. There are also many good cafe's in the neighborhood, in which you can relax with a bottle of wine and good food after your long day exploring Roma. For those of you who are surfing the NET to find an inexpensive hotel (3 stars), in order to not spend a lot of your travel money on lodging, but pleasurable hotel for your stay in Rome...THIS IS IT!

Reviews.Title: “great time at the Palladium Palace”
Reviews.Author: terryirie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Palladium Palace for 3 nights from 12 September for my 50th birthday celebrations and had a fantastic time. I was upgraded as a treat from the management and the room and hotel was clean and friendly. The staff were exceptionally helpful especially Bruno the porter and barman and Paul on reception. They guided us in the right direction for great local restaurants which was a bonus after a long days of walking and sightseeing. Excellent location for all forms of transport. We couldn't have picked a nicer place to stay and will definitely be going back and would recommend it to anyone. Giovanni's restaurant around the corner made our last night in Rome very special. Valentino is a bit of a comedian a small family run restaurant with a great guitarist and singer to round off the evening. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Struggling to find fault with this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean, comfy hotel in a good location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved my stay there, hope to return sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hats off to the Palladium Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Palladium Palace for 6 days (in room 408) and I can only agree with most other reviewers that the place is truly great value for money. It's spotlessly clean, service is fast, friendly and helpful and the first hotel I have ever stayed in where the airconditioning worked like a Swiss watch (or Japanese, rather, these days...) The location is quite close to the railway station, a slightly seedy, but nevertheless very convenient place, while the double glazing on the windows excluded street noise completely. The area is teeming with all sorts of convenient shops, food, travel appliances, etc. and all of it a lot cheaper than in central Rome. Everything in the room worked and room service was excellent. On one occasion the cold water supply was cut off for some reason, perhaps, for temporary repairs (?) Within 20 minutes it was restored again, with plentiful apologies. Breakfast room on the terrace in the brilliant Rome sunshine, food fresh and well presented, what else would one want from a hotel? In addition, the price was very reasonable (and I have a good deal of experience in this in most parts of the world...) and again, the location of the hotel means that you are right next door to all public transport facilities including the fast train to the airport from the Termini as well as the underground central point and the various city bus tours. In the event, I hired a scooter from a rental agency on the next corner and played Dolce Vita in Rome! Recommend the place thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms for Four”
Reviews.Author: Kbrossel
Reviews.Content: We understand it is hard to find a room for 2 adults and 2 kids. This hotel did a great job. We had a Queen size bed with 2 single on each side. The room was large enough to get around in easily. The staff and management were excellant. VERY HELPFUL with directions and money exchange at a fair rate. Also right near the train station ( one block) so it would be OK for the transfer from the airport by train as a taxi cost us $100.00. The train is 10 Euros each I believe. The breakfast is a bit sparce with fruit, bread, cereal, cheese and sliced meat but no warm food. It was sufficient and clean though. Overall it was an excellant choice and the staff stands out as being great in a small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: myself and 21 other people stayed here in july as i was getting married in rome. We got a good price on the hotel and it was very central. The day staff were very friendly but the night staff were very rude and i felt they were doing us a favour by allowing us to stay there. There was a strong smell in one of the rooms and i notified them on two occasions but nothing was done, we were staying there for a week so it was a long time to have to endure this smell. Overall the hotel was just ok and i wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price & truly clean hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you that my wife and I researched for nearly two months hotels on the internet, reading reviews for our trip to Italy between July 15 to July 27 last. In the end it was worth the research. Hotel Palladium was a great 3 star hotel located minutes from the main train station whose staff was friendly, rooms renovated including the marble and tiled bathroom. Not only were the rooms and bathroom very clean, the lobby and passages of the hotel smelt and looked clean. Breakfast was served on the roof top terrace with plenty of goodies to start your day. Since we researched alot, I remembered several hotel names as we passed them on the street and would peak into the lobby to see if we made the right choice. Trust me when I say that after seeing what some other 3 star hotels looked like, I can say with confidence that for price and quality, the Palladium is worth your stay. P.S. the pictures of the hotel on the internet are true depictions of the hotels. What you see is what you get. (The other hotels we stayed at were: Adler Cavalieri in Florence, Ai Mori D'Oriente in Venice, Villa Latartana in Positano and La Minerva in Capri).

Reviews.Title: “the right place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in Mirano (region Veneto). My girlfriend came to visit me and we had an unforgettable holiday together (3 weeks: 3 – 24 July). We visited 6 beautiful cities : Venice, Padova, Florence, Rome, Naples, Capri Island. In all this places we stayed at the hotel. Final conclusion: no doubts, the best of all was absolutely Hotel Palladium Palace in Rome, where we remained a whole week. The staff (Gianfranco, Stefano, Paolo, Marcello) is always very operative, gentle, courteous and helpful. They adviced us with many details how to visit the city in a pleasant way, so we didn’t walk empty around the city loosing our time. They arranged us some guided tours, reservation in different restaurants, we received information for shopping area, educative commentaries about history, religion, traditions. We had a very comfortable room (410) full-option, silent and bright, the breakfast rich and tasty. I use to stay very often in hotel, I can surely say that I have never had such a good service and treatment. I will always recommend Hotel Palladium to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: suzjohn20
Reviews.Content: I used your reviews as a guide to find a hotel in Rome (I was booking for 3 couples) and I think the reviews for this Hotel are very accurate. We stayed here for 3 nights. This place was very nice - close to public transportation with a very helpful staff. My one complaint is the sewer smell that comes up through the bathroom. It seemed to come and go in surges but at one point I thought we had a dead animal in the room it was so bad. The air conditioning helped. Breakfast was quite good with a large selection.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place for it's location and room size only. You are literally only 5 minutes from the main train station where the subway and all major buslines pass. While the standards are average for Europe, the price is a bit high for Italy. I agree with other reviewers that the location after dark can be daunting; it's not unsafe, but it's also not Piazza Navona. My single room had 3 twin beds for some reason. The bathrooms are okay, if you can accept the door hitting the toilet and showering without a curtain, but you are provided the same ammenities as in a more expensive hotel. The room was very quiet despite being on the street. The staff was excellent and the service was pleasant. My one gripe was that breakfast opened at 7 and I had to get a train at the station at 6:45, thus forcing me to forfeit the rooftop cappucino I had been anticipating.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palladium Palace
HotelInfo.Address: 36 via Gioberti | 75 via principe amedeo, 00185 Rome, Italy
